Douhau Data Studio User’s Guide 1 Introduction

Douhau Data Studio User’s Guide Ippei Akiya 2021-01-17 1 Introduction This user’s guide provides how to install and use Douhau Data Studio which is desktop application for browsing CDISC SDTM data. The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.org/tinytex/.

2 Installation 2.1 Configure R environment Since, Douhau Data Studio build and run based on R Shiny framework, it is necessary to install and configure the R environment. 2.1.1 R installation 2.1.1.1 For windows users R is obtain freely from CRAN web site. https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/R-4.0.3-win.exe And after to finish download, installer R-4.0.3-win.exe should be launch and to complete R installation. Next, user path environment for R has to be configured through the following steps. Check the path of installed R install.packages( c( "shiny", "shinydashboard", "dplyr", "stringr", "SASxport", "R.utils", "yaml", "devtools" ) ) library(devtools) install_github("i-akiya/R4DSXML/R4DSXML")
